title: ICE: min_specilization `When translating substitutions .. the expected specialization failed to hold`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code ```Rust #![crate_type="lib"] #![feature(min_specialization)] trait X {} trait Y: X {} trait Z { type Assoc: Y; } struct A(T); impl Z for A {} impl From< as Z>::Assoc> for T {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (ec2f40c6b 2023-03-30) binary: rustc commit-hash: ec2f40c6b04f0e9850dd1f454e8639d319f4ed9b commit-date: 2023-03-30 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/specialize/mod.rs:104:21: When translating substitutions from DefId(0:13 ~ treereduce[d8c8]::{impl#1}) to DefId(2:2554 ~ core[ad74]::convert::{impl#4}), the expected specialization failed to hold thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/ec2f40c6b04f0e9850dd1f454e8639d319f4ed9b/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1644:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7fe921565e8a -
